intro: Meisteria campanulata var. albiflora, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate, fragrant blooms and its ability to thrive in a variety of garden settings.
